fields.label: Ultrasound test
fields.label_info_text: An ultrasound is recommended for all women before 24 weeks gestation or even after if deemed necessary (e.g. to identify the number of fetuses, fetal presentation, or placenta location).

fields.hint: Specify any other reason why the ultrasound test was not done. *

v_required.err: Specify any other reason why the ultrasound test was not done.

fields.hint: Date that the ultrasound was done.*

v_required.err: Date that the ultrasound was done.

fields.hint: Gestational age in weeks from ultrasound. *

v_required.err: Please specify the gestational age in weeks from ultrasound

fields.hint: Gestational age in days from ultrasound. *

v_required.err: Please specify the gestational age in days from ultrasound

fields.toaster_info_text: An early U/S is key to estimate gestational age, improve detection of fetal anomalies and multiple fetuses, reduce induction of labour for post-term pregnancy, and improve a womanâ€™s pregnancy experience.

fields.text: Number of fetuses detected during ultrasound.

fields.toaster_info_text: The use of aspirin after 12 weeks gestation is recommended as well as calcium if low dietary intake area. Please also provide counseling.

fields.label: Select preferred gestational age: Using LMP Using ultrasound Using SFH or abdominal palpation

v_required.err: Date that the blood test was done.

fields.toaster_info_text:
- Woman is at risk of alloimmunisation if the baby's father is Rh positive or unknown.

- Proceed with local protocol to investigate sensitization and the need for referral.

- If Rh negative and non-sensitized, woman should receive anti

- D prophylaxis postnatally if the baby is Rh positive.

v_required.err: Specify any other reason why an HIV test was not done.

fields.text: HIV test inconclusive, refer for further testing.

fields.toaster_info_text:
- Refer for further testing and confirmation

- Refer for HIV services

- Advise on opportunistic infections and need to seek medical help

- Proceed with systematic screening for active TB

fields.text: Partner HIV test inconclusive, refer partner for further testing.

fields.toaster_info_text:
Provide comprehensive HIV prevention options: 

- STI screening and treatment (syndromic and syphilis)

- Condom promotion

- Risk reduction counselling

- PrEP with emphasis on adherence

- Emphasize importance of follow-up ANC contact visits

fields.label: Hepatitis B test
fields.label_info_text: In settings where the proportion of HBsAg seroprevalence in the general population is 2% or higher or in settings where there is a national Hep B ANC routine screening program in place, or if the woman is HIV positive, injects drugs, or is a sex worker, then Hep B testing is recommended if the woman is not fully vaccinated against Hep B.

v_required.err: Specify any other reason why the Hep B test was not done.

fields.toaster_info_text: Hep B vaccination required anytime after 12 weeks gestation.

fields.label: Hepatitis C test
fields.label_info_text: In settings where the proportion of HCV antibody seroprevalence in the general population is 2% or higher, or the woman is HIV positive, injects drugs, or is a sex worker, then a Hep C test is required.

v_required.err: Specify any other reason why the Hep C test was not done.
Select the date of the Hepatitis C test.

fields.label: Hep C test type
fields.label_info_text: Anti-HCV laboratory-based immunoassay is the preferred method for testing for Hep C infection in pregnancy. If immunoassay is not available, Anti-HCV rapid diagnostic test (RDT) is recommended over Dried Blood Spot (DBS) Anti-HCV testing.

fields.label: Syphilis test
fields.label_info_text: A syphilis test is recommended for all pregnant women at the first contact and again at the first contact of 3rd trimester (28 weeks). Women who are already confirmed positive for syphilis do not need to be tested.

fields.text: This area has a high prevalence of syphilis (5% or greater).
fields.toaster_info_text: Use an on-site rapid syphilis test (RST), and, if positive, provide the first dose of treatment. Then refer the woman for a rapid plasma reagin (RPR) test. If the RPR test is positive, provide treatment according to the clinical phase of syphilis.
fields.toaster_info_title: This area has a high prevalence of syphilis (5% or greater).

fields.text: This area has a low prevalence of syphilis (below 5%)
fields.toaster_info_text: On-site rapid syphilis test (RST) should be used to test pregnant women for syphilis.
fields.toaster_info_title: This area has a low prevalence of syphilis (below 5%)

v_required.err: Specify any other reason why the syphilis test was not done
Select the date of the syphilis test.

fields.toaster_info_text: Provide counselling and treatment according to protocol.
